sage.camera

Interface ICamera

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractCamera, JOGLCamera

    public interface ICamera
    Specifies the interface which must be implemented by every SAGE camera. Note that graphics-system dependent camera implementations should extend AbstractCamera, which implements this interface. Camera implementations should then override the implementations provided by AbstractCamera as necessary to match this interface to the underlying system implementation of a camera.
    Author:
    John Clevenger

    • Method Detail

      • getRightAxis

        graphicslib3D.Vector3D getRightAxis()
        Returns the camera local-space "right axis" (sometimes called the camera's "X" or "U" axis).
        Returns:
        a Vector3D pointing in the direction of the camera's "right" axis.

      • getUpAxis

        graphicslib3D.Vector3D getUpAxis()
        Returns the camera local-space "up axis" (sometimes called the camera's "Y" or "V" axis).
        Returns:
        a Vector3D pointing in the direction of the camera's "up" axis.

      • getViewDirection

        graphicslib3D.Vector3D getViewDirection()
        Returns the camera local-space "view direction axis" (sometimes called the camera's "Z" or "N" axis).
        Returns:
        a Vector3D pointing in the direction of the camera's "view direction" axis.

      • getLocation

        graphicslib3D.Point3D getLocation()
        Returns the location of the camera in world coordinate space.
        Returns:
        a Point3D giving the camera's world location

      • setRightAxis

        void setRightAxis(graphicslib3D.Vector3D right)
        Sets the camera's "right" ("U" or "X") axis to the given Vector3D. Note that it is the responsibility of the client to insure that when camera axes are changed that they still form an orthogonal system (that is, that the camera's axes remain mutually perpendicular).
        Parameters:
        right - - the new camera "right" axis

      • setUpAxis

        void setUpAxis(graphicslib3D.Vector3D up)
        Sets the camera's "up" ("Y" or "V") axis to the given Vector3D. Note that it is the responsibility of the client to insure that when camera axes are changed that they still form an orthogonal system (that is, that the camera's axes remain mutually perpendicular).
        Parameters:
        up - - the new camera "up" axis

      • setViewDirection

        void setViewDirection(graphicslib3D.Vector3D dir)
        Sets the camera's "view direction" ("Z" or "N") axis to the given Vector3D. Note that it is the responsibility of the client to insure that when camera axes are changed that they still form an orthogonal system (that is, that the camera's axes remain mutually perpendicular).
        Parameters:
        dir - - the new camera "view direction" axis

      • setLocation

        void setLocation(graphicslib3D.Point3D loc)
        Sets the camera's position to the specified world location.
        Parameters:
        loc - - the new camera location

      • setAxes

        void setAxes(graphicslib3D.Vector3D right,
             graphicslib3D.Vector3D up,
             graphicslib3D.Vector3D viewDir)
        A convenience method for setting all three camera axes at once. Note that it is the responsibility of the client to insure that when camera axes are changed that they still form an orthogonal system (that is, that the camera's axes remain mutually perpendicular).
        Parameters:
        right - - the new camera "right" (U) axis
        up - - the new camera "up" (V) axis
        viewDir - - the new camera "view direction" (N) axis

      • lookAt

        void lookAt(graphicslib3D.Point3D target,
            graphicslib3D.Vector3D worldUp)
        A convenience method for setting the camera axes based on the position of a specified target point. Sets the camera's view direction (N) axis to point from the camera location to the specified target location; uses the specified worldUp vector to determine the direction of the camera's V (up) axis (more formally, sets the camera's V axis to the projection of the worldUp vector onto a plane perpendicular to the camera's N axis); and sets the camera's right (U) axis to a direction perpendicular to the new N and V axes. The direction from the camera to the target must not be identical to the worldUp direction.
        Parameters:
        target - - the 3D point which the camera should point toward
        worldUp - - the direction of "up" in the world, from which the camera's "up" vector is computed

      • setPerspectiveFrustum

        void setPerspectiveFrustum(double fovY,
                           double aspect,
                           double near,
                           double far)
        Sets the parameters defining the camera perspective view volume (frustum).
        Parameters:
        fovY - - the vertical (Y) angle of the frustum, in degrees
        aspect - - the aspect ratio (width:height) of the view frustum
        near - - the distance from the camera to the near clipping plane; must be > 0
        far - - the distance from the camera to the far clipping plane; must be > near

      • getPerspectiveFrustumSettings

        double[] getPerspectiveFrustumSettings()
        Returns an array containing the values defining the current camera view volume frustum setting.
        Returns:
        - an array of doubles, where [0]=fovY, [1]=aspect ratio, [2]=near plane distance and [3]= far plane distance

      • setViewport

        void setViewport(double left,
                 double right,
                 double bottom,
                 double top)
        Sets the viewport boundaries for this camera on the screen, as a percentage (range 0 to 1) of screen width/height. In other words, this method specifies the portion of the display screen where the world view seen by this camera should be displayed.
        Parameters:
        left - - the left viewport boundary, where 0.0 means the far left side of the display
        right - - the right viewport boundary; 1.0 means the far right side of the display
        bottom - - the bottom viewport boundary; 0.0 means all the way at the bottom of the display
        top - - the top viewport boundary; 1.0 means all the way at the top of the display

      • getViewport

        double[] getViewport()
        Returns the current viewport boundaries for this camera on the screen as four elements of an array, each element containing a percentage (range 0 to 1) of screen width/height, with [0]=left, [1]=right, [2]=bottom, and [3]=top.

      • applySettings

        void applySettings()
        Forces the camera to update the underlying graphics system camera implementation to match this camera's current settings. Note that prior to calling applySettings() it is not valid to assume that the underlying graphics system contains the current camera settings.

      • isOutOfDate

        boolean isOutOfDate()
        Returns a flag indicating whether the underlying graphics system camera settings currently match this camera's settings.
        Returns:
        - true if the underlying graphics system camera is out of date (that is, its settings do NOT match this camera's settings; false if the underlying camera implementation is current

      • intersects

        boolean intersects(BoundingVolume bv)
        Returns true if the specified BoundingVolume intersects the current camera view frustum. Note that touching is considered an intersection.
        Parameters:
        bv - The BoundingVolume to compare against the view frustum
        Returns:
        true if the BoundingVolume intersects the view frustum

      • getHUD

        Group getHUD()
        Returns a Group defining the HUD elements for this ICamera.
        Returns:
        a Group containing the camera's HUD elements

      • addToHUD

        void addToHUD(SceneNode child)
        Adds the specified SceneNode to this ICamera's HUD.
        Parameters:
        child - - the SceneNode to be added to the camera HUD

      • removeFromHUD

        boolean removeFromHUD(SceneNode child)
        Removes the specified SceneNode from this ICamera's HUD, if the element is present in the HUD.
        Parameters:
        child - - the element to be removed from the camera's HUD
        Returns:
        - true if the element was found and removed; false otherwise
